bill.title: Requiring maintenance of the COVID-19 dashboard.
bill.description: Requiring maintenance of the COVID-19 dashboard.

history.action: Introduced (in recess of) 01/06/2021 and referred to Health, Human Services and Elderly Affairs House Journal  2 P. 51

Public Hearing: 02/16/2021 01:00 pm Members of the public may attend using the following link:To join the webinar: https://www.zoom.us/j/94563888809 / Executive session on pending legislation may be held throughout the day (time permitting) from the time the committee is initially convened.
Executive Session: 03/02/2021 12:30 pm Members of the public may attend using the following links:To join the webinar: https://www.zoom.us/j/99282187833
Committee Report: Inexpedient to Legislate (Vote 19-0; Consent Calendar) House Calendar 18 P. 16
Inexpedient to Legislate: Motion Adopted Voice Vote 04/07/2021 House Journal  5 P. 35
Reconsider (Rep. Osborne): Motion Failed Voice Vote 04/07/2021 House Journal  5 P. 50

bill.full_text: department of health and human services dashboard the department of health and human services in collaboration with the university system of new hampshire shall maintain a website known as the dashboard to provide timely and accurate information to the public regarding the state of the novel coronavirus in new hampshire the website shall serve as an information clearinghouse with essential guidance for schools and local communities during the pandemic separate sections of the dashboard shall track nursing homes prisons and congregate living settings in the same way that case specific information regarding schools is tracked another section of the dashboard shall track vaccination metrics by age race town and eligibility category vaccination information shall be maintained in a way that allows for of geographic location age race and eligibility category the department shall update the dashboard on a daily basis and ensure that it is available to the public a day days a week legislative committee established there is established a committee to study health disparities experienced by populations during the pandemic the members of the committee shall be as follows a four members of the house of representatives appointed by the speaker of the house of representatives two of whom shall be nominated by the minority leader b two members of the senate appointed by the president of the senate one of whom shall be nominated by the minority leader members of the committee shall receive mileage at the legislative rate when attending to the duties of the committee the committee shall study health disparities experienced by populations during the crisis the committee shall consider ways to improve safety for vulnerable populations including prison inmates nursing home residents and others living in congregate living settings the committee may solicit information and testimony from any individual or entity it deems relevant to the study the members of the study committee shall elect a chairperson from among the members the first meeting of the committee shall be called by the house member the first meeting of the committee shall be held within days of the effective date of this paragraph four members of the committee shall constitute a quorum the committee shall report its findings and any recommendations for proposed legislation to the speaker of the house of representatives the president of the senate the house clerk the senate clerk the governor and the state library on or before november
